articles.title: Greetings to President of Cuban State of Council
articles.content:
Greetings to President of Cuban State of Council
 Pyongyang, February 26 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, first chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK, sent a message of greeting to Raul Castro Ruz, president of the Council of State of the Republic of Cuba, on Monday.
					 The message said:
					
					 I extend warm congratulations to you upon your re-election as president of the Council of State of the Republic of Cuba at the First Meeting of the 8th National Assembly of People's Power of Cuba.
					
					 I wish you greater success in your responsible work to defend the sovereignty and dignity of the country and triumphantly advance the socialist cause.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un Sends Gifts to Contributors to Successful Nuclear Test
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Sends Gifts to Contributors to Successful Nuclear Test
 Pyongyang, February 26 (KCNA) -- The dear respected Kim Jong Un sent gifts to scientists, technicians, workers, soldier-builders and officials who contributed to the successful third underground nuclear test.
					 This is a clear indication of the great trust of Kim Jong Un in them. He put them forward as the first comrades and comrades-in-arms of the Workers' Party of Korea as they performed exploits in turning the DPRK into a nuclear weapons state recognized by the world.
					
					 A gift-conveying ceremony took place on Tuesday.
					
					 Present there were Pak To Chun, member of the Political Bureau and secretary of the WPK Central Committee, officials concerned and those contributors.
					
					 Pak made an address to be followed by speeches.
					
					 The speakers said they will convey today's honour from generation to generation.
					
					 They vowed to rapidly develop the nuclear technology of the country by devoting all their wisdom and energy.

articles.title: Contributors to Successful Nuclear Test Feted
articles.content:
Contributors to Successful Nuclear Test Feted
 Pyongyang, February 26 (KCNA) -- A banquet was given at Yanggakdo International Hotel Tuesday in honour of scientists, technicians, workers, soldier-builders and officials who contributed to the successful third underground nuclear test.
					 Present there were Choe Yong Rim, Choe Thae Bok, Pak To Chun, Jo Yon Jun and officials concerned.
					
					 The senior officials of the Party, state and all hands in the hotel warmly greeted the contributors.
					
					 Choe Thae Bok, member of the Political Bureau and secretary of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, spoke at the banquet.
					
					 He said that a great success in the recent nuclear test, another victory in the all-out action against the enemies, is a great national event to be specially recorded, which was brought about by the iron will and matchless grit of the dear respected Marshal Kim Jong Un.
					
					 He called upon those in the field of national defence science to live up to the great trust and expectation of the Party in their heart of hearts, always bearing in their minds benevolence of Kim Jong Un.
					
					 He also called upon them to cherish Kim Jong Il's patriotism, make great innovations and leaping progress in the drive of pushing back the frontiers of science and technology for steadily bolstering up the nuclear deterrent of the country with the same spirit and mettle as displayed in succeeding in the nuclear test and thus make positive contributions to fully demonstrating the dignity and the national power of the great Paektusan nation.
					
					 A performance was given by employees of the hotel.

articles.title: Contributors to Successful Nuclear Test Visit Fitness Centre in Thongil Street
articles.content:
Contributors to Successful Nuclear Test Visit Fitness Centre in Thongil Street
						
 Pyongyang, February 26 (KCNA) -- Scientists, technicians, workers and officials in national defence science and soldier-builders who contributed to the successful third underground nuclear test visited the Fitness Centre in Thongil Street on Tuesday.
					 As they arrived, the employees of the Centre warmly welcomed them, hanging garlands around their necks and presenting bouquets to them.
					
					 They went round various places of the Centre, being briefed on the fact that it has been built as mass service base conducive to physical training of people and promotion of their health.
					
					 They admired good exercise apparatuses for running, bicycling and rowing and modern treatment equipment.
					
					 They spent joyful time at health exercise room, underwater ultrasonic wave room, health recovery room, table-tennis room and soft drink bar.

articles.title: Greetings to Kim Jong Un from V. V. Zhirinovsky
articles.content:
Greetings to Kim Jong Un from V. V. Zhirinovsky
 Pyongyang, February 26 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, first secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea, received a message of greeting from V. V. Zhirinovsky, chairman of the Liberal Democratic Party of Russia, on Feb. 16.
					 The message extended wholehearted congratulations to Kim Jong Un on the occasion of February 16, the birth anniversary of Kim Jong Il, the great leader of the DPRK, and hoped that peace will settle on the Korean Peninsula and all citizens of the DPRK achieve prosperity.

articles.title: Greetings to Kim Jong Un from S. M. Mironov
articles.content:
Greetings to Kim Jong Un from S. M. Mironov
 Pyongyang, February 26 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, first secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea, received a message of greeting from S. M. Mironov, leader of "A Just Russia", on Feb. 18.
					 The message said:
					
					 I extend congratulations to you and, through you, to all the Korean people on behalf of "A Just Russia" and on my own behalf on the occasion of the Day of the Shining Star, the national holiday.
					
					 I wish you good health and happiness and all citizens of the DPRK great successes.
					
					 I hope that the cooperation between our two countries and between "A Just Russia" and the WPK will make fruitful progress.

articles.title: Ex-Player of American NBA Arrives Here
articles.content:
Ex-Player of American NBA, His Party Arrive Here
 Pyongyang, February 26 (KCNA) -- Ex-player of the NBA of the U.S. Dennis Rodman and his party arrived here Tuesday.
					 They were greeted at the airport by Son Kwang Ho, vice-chairman of the DPRK Olympic Committee, and officials concerned.

articles.title: Russian Political Party Leader Meets WPK Delegation
articles.content:
En Pyongyang jugador retirado de NBA y su comitiva 
 Pyongyang, 26 de febrero (ACNC) -- Arribaron este martes a esta capital el jugador retirado de NBA (Asociacion Nacional de Baloncesto) de Estados Unidos, Dennis Rodman y su comitiva.
					 Los huespedes fueron acogidos en el aeropuerto por el vicepresidente del Comite Olimpico de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Son Kwang Ho y otros funcionarios interesados.

articles.title: Reception Given at Syrian Embassy to Mark Day of Shining Star
articles.content:
Reception Given at Syrian Embassy to Mark Day of Shining Star
 Pyongyang, February 26 (KCNA) -- Haissam Saad, charge d'affaires ad interim of the Syrian embassy here, hosted a reception at his embassy on Tuesday to mark the birth anniversary of general secretary Kim Jong Il (the Day of the Shining Star).
					 Present there on invitation were Yang Hyong Sop, vice-president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly, Kim Yong Il, secretary of the C.C., the Workers' Party of Korea, Ri Ryong Nam, minister of Foreign Trade, Choe Chang Sik, minister of Public Health, and others.
					
					 A staff member of the Syrian embassy attended it.
					
					 Haissam Saad in his speech at the reception said that under the wise leadership of Kim Jong Il the DPRK has made a lot of achievements in various fields by foiling the obstructive moves of the hostile forces. The DPRK has conquered space and had an access to nuclear deterrence, he noted.
					
					 The Korean people are making great progress in their efforts to realize the idea and wish of great President Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il, true to the leadership of the dear respected Kim Jong Un, he added.
					
					 He expressed belief that the friendly relations between the two countries would grow stronger under the deep care of Kim Jong Un and Bashar Al-Assad.
					
					 Yang Hyong Sop in his speech said Kim Jong Il made undying contributions to the prosperity of the country and the cause of global independence under the banner of Songun.
					
					 Final victory is in store for the DPRK as there is the wise guidance of Kim Jong Un, who is glorifying the revolutionary career and feats of Kim Jong Il, he noted.
					
					 It is the consistent stand of the DPRK government to value and boost the traditional relations of friendship and cooperation with Syria, he stressed.

articles.title: DPRK Servicepersons Vow to Annihilate Provokers
articles.content:
DPRK Servicepersons Vow to Annihilate Provokers
 Pyongyang, February 26 (KCNA) -- Servicepersons of the Korean People's Internal Security Forces (KPISF) are intensifying their combat training with bitter hatred for the U.S. imperialists and their followers and strong will to destroy their provocations.
					 At a training ground of the Kang Chol Gyu-led unit of KPISF, an officer, Wi Kwang Myong, told KCNA:
					
					 "The U.S. and the south Korean puppet regime are staging large-scale war exercises, calling the DPRK's successful nuclear test a big threat to them.
					
					 They assert that the DPRK should give up its nuclear weapons, while threatening it with thousands of nukes. Such gangster-like logic can never work on us.
					
					 We will further raise the hot wind of military training just as the anti-Japanese guerrillas did in Mt. Paektu, in hearty response to the strategic plan of the respected Supreme Commander Kim Jong Un and in keeping with the spirit of the enlarged meeting of the Central Military Commission of the Workers' Party of Korea."
					
					 Another officer Ko Yong Ho said:
					
					 "The U.S. imperialists and the south Korean puppet forces are getting hell-bent on war exercises, crying out for "punishment" of the DPRK over its peaceful satellite launch and nuclear test.
					
					 A club is fit for a rabid dog.
					
					 If they dare pounce upon the DPRK, they will face death by merciless strikes of its powerful revolutionary Paektusan army."
					
					 A non-commissioned officer, Han Nam, said:
					
					 "We regard the country's sovereignty more valuable than our lives.
					
					 The enemies are dazed by the mettle of the DPRK, which has risen to be a full-fledged nuclear state and a satellite-launching state.
					
					 If they hurt the dignity of the DPRK even a bit, we will never miss this chance to achieve the cause of the national reunification by dint of military strength."

articles.title: Birthday Spreads Sent to Persons of Distinguished Services
articles.content:
Birthday Spreads Sent to Persons of Distinguished Services
 Pyongyang, February 26 (KCNA) -- The dear respected Marshal Kim Jong Un sent birthday spreads to Academician, Prof. and Dr. Ko Kyong Dal, winner of Kim Jong Il Prize and researcher at Kim Chaek University of Technology, Labor Hero Jong Sun Won, manager of an affiliated unit under the South Hwanghae Provincial Fishery Management Bureau, and People's Athlete O Sun Jin, senior coach of weightlifting at the sports group of the Tongrim Mining Machine Factory.
					 Ko Kyong Dal, who was born into a family of day laborer before the liberation of the country, devoted his wisdom and enthusiasm to the work for training scientific and technological talents and developing the metal industry of the country for decades.
					
					 During these days, he pioneered several subjects of special study, wrote many textbooks and reference books and brought up tens of winners of academic degrees and titles.
					
					 Jong Sun Won has contributed to the development of the country's fishery for a long time.
					
					 He created hundreds of hectares of seaweed culture grounds and increased the production of fish and seaweed every year defying natural conditions.
					
					 O Sun Jin has worked as teacher and senior coach of weightlifting, bringing up famous sports including those honored with titles of Labor Hero, People's Athlete and Merited Athlete.

articles.title: KCNA Commentary Accuses Japan of Discriminating against Koreans
articles.content:
KCNA Commentary Accuses Japan of Discriminating against Koreans
 Pyongyang, February 26 (KCNA) -- The Ministry of Education, Culture, Sports, Science and Technology of Japan on Feb. 20 officially decided to exclude the Korean schools only from the tuition-free program for senior high schools.
					 Earlier, Saitama and Kanagawa prefectures announced their decisions to cancel the payment of grants-in-aid for Korean schools in the prefectures where Korean children attend. 
					
					 This goes to clearly prove that the Japanese authorities' hostile acts toward the DPRK have reached the extreme phase of inciting national chauvinism across society.
					
					  The Japanese reactionaries set even Korean children in Japan as the target of hostile policy toward the DPRK after its successful nuclear test. They are, indeed, brazen and unscrupulous political gangsters without an equal in the world.
					
					 The children of Koreans in Japan are the descendants of those who were forcibly taken to Japan for military service and labor conscription. Some Koreans crossed the Korean Strait with the grief of statelessness under the colonial fascist rule by the Japanese imperialists.
					
					 The Japanese reactionaries have legal and moral responsibility and duty to fully ensure the activities of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan and the democratic national rights of Koreans in Japan.
					
					 The said hostile acts amount to human rights abuses and violation of sovereignty that can never be justified.
					
					  The International Convention on the Elimination of All Forms of Racial Discrimination adopted at the UN in 1965 said that discrimination, exclusion and restriction based on blood and nationality are included in racial discrimination, defining organizations promoting the said crimes and those who are involved in them as international criminals.
					
					 Japan, a war criminal state, committed national discrimination acts against Koreans in Japan, its victims, stirring up the bitterest resentment and hostility of the army and the people of the DPRK.
					
					 Clear is the aim of the Japanese reactionaries' politically-motivated pressure upon the Koreans in Japan.
					
					 They seek to put heavy financial burden on the Korean schools and Koreans in Japan in a bid to obliterate the national education and stamp out Chongryon, legitimate overseas compatriots organization of the DPRK. 
					
					 Japan's act of national discrimination aimed to deprive Koreans in Japan of their rights and force them into submission is a serious crime pending urgent discussion and punishment on the international arena as contemporary slavery.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Slams Anti-DPRK Confrontation Moves of U.S., S. Korea
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Slams Anti-DPRK Confrontation Moves of U.S., S. Korea 
 Pyongyang, February 26 (KCNA) -- All Koreans should turn out in the just struggle to frustrate the persistent confrontation moves by the anti-reunification forces and achieve peace and reunification of the country, Rodong Sinmun Tuesday says in a bylined article. 
					 It is the steadfast will and stand of the army and people of the DPRK to continuously take stronger steps to cope with the hostile acts of the U.S. and its allied forces that defy the DPRK's warnings, the article says, and goes on:
					
					 The reunification of the country is the most urgent and important task for the Korean nation. 
					
					 For nearly seven decades the Korean nation has suffered from separation. It is not because of lack of the nation's efforts for reunification. 
					
					 It is entirely attributable to the vicious anti-DPRK confrontation moves of the U.S., which has resorted to the criminal hostile policy towards the DPRK, and the south Korean traitorous ruling quarters who sold out the sovereignty and interests of the nation against the reconciliation and unity of the nation to please their master, the U.S. 
					
					 Now the situation of the Korean Peninsula is getting extremely acute owing to the brigandish anti-DPRK hostile acts of the U.S. and its allies violating the dignity and sovereignty of the DPRK. 
					
					 The joint military exercises Key Resolve and Foal Eagle the U.S. and south Korea plan to stage are the culmination of the anti-DPRK confrontation campaign. 
					
					 It is impossible to defend the sovereignty of the country and security of the nation unless the confrontation campaign for a war by the U.S. and the south Korean puppet forces is stopped. 
					
					 It is natural for the service personnel and people of the DPRK regarding the sovereignty and dignity of the country as more valuable than their lives to turn out in an all-out action to frustrate the reckless moves of the disgusting U.S. and south Korean warmongers.

articles.title: Chon Yong U Hit Out for Defaming DPRK's Dignity
articles.content:
Chon Yong U Hit Out for Defaming DPRK's Dignity
 Pyongyang, February 26 (KCNA) -- Chon Yong U, a henchman of Lee Myung Bak of south Korea, appeared at a recent press conference to defame the DPRK over its nuclear test.
					 While talking about "mental pressure", Chon called for "slapping the north with sanctions which it can not afford to manage".
					
					 He also recommended the next regime to re-examine its "north policy" on the premise of the "impossibility of peaceful co-existence with the north".
					
					 A bylined commentary of Rodong Sinmun Tuesday dismisses the reckless remarks made by Chon by clinging to coattail of Lee Myung Bak, more dead than alive, as spasmodic ones of a maniac engrossed in confrontation with the north.
					
					 Chon can never be pardoned for having let loose invectives against his countrymen and even slandered the dignity of the supreme leadership of the DPRK despite his fate edging toward the end, said the commentary, adding:
					
					 Chon's call for "mental pressure" and "tightened sanctions" can never be construed otherwise than a last-ditch effort of those who have been put in predicament, taken aback by the DPRK's massive political and military capability.
					
					 It is the south Korean authorities who feel the "mental pressure", not the DPRK. They, the colonial stooges of outsiders, cling to the coattail of the U.S., begging it to stage war drills and protect south Korea with nukes.
					
					 The facts go to prove that the Lee Myung Bak group consists of betes noires who plot to do harm to the fellow countrymen till the last moments of its departure from power.
					
					 However vocal Chon becomes in defaming the DPRK, its dignity and stamina will be demonstrated more glaringly with each passing day.
					
					 No one can block the DPRK army and people's vigorous advance toward the road of independence, Songun and socialism.

articles.title: Minju Joson Ridicules Story of "Provocation by North"
articles.content:
Minju Joson Ridicules Story of "Provocation by North"
 Pyongyang, February 26 (KCNA) -- The U.S. and south Korean warmongers loudly say that "the north seriously threatened global peace and security" and that "it is necessary to strengthen the south Korea-U.S. joint posture to cope with the north's additional provocation" in a bid to cover up the criminal nature of the joint military exercises. 
					 Minju Joson Tuesday observes in a bylined commentary in this regard: 
					
					 The story of "provocation by the north" spread by the U.S. and south Korean warmongers is nonsensical sophism reminding one of "the guilty party filing the suit first". 
					
					 The DPRK's sovereignty and right to existence are exposed to the grave threat due to the U.S. persistent attempt to stifle it and hostile policy towards it. 
					
					 The U.S. has long put the DPRK in the list of the targets of preemptive nuclear attack. It has gravely threatened the DPRK with nukes and resorted to every means and method to stifle it by ceaseless military pressure and economic sanctions. 
					
					 The U.S. madcap anti-DPRK confrontation campaign is the last-ditch effort of those who have worked in vain to meet their sinister intention to ignite a war in Korea and stifle the DPRK militarily.
					
					 It is clearly proved by the fact that the U.S. announced that it would stage as scheduled the joint military exercises Key Resolve, drill for preemptive nuclear attack on the north, though it is under pressure to reduce defense budget.
					
					 The DPRK does not want a war, but is not afraid of it at all. 
					
					 If the U.S. imperialists ignite a war at last in this land, all the service personnel and people of the DPRK will give revengeful blow to them and achieve national reunification without fail.

articles.title: Japan Denounced for Discriminating against Korean Schools
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un envia regalos a contribuyentes a la prueba nuclear 
 Pyongyang, 26 de febrero (ACNC) -- El Mariscal Kim Jong Un envio presentes a los cientificos, tecnicos, obreros, constructores militares y funcionarios quienes contribuyeron al exito de la tercera prueba nuclear subterranea.
					 En ellos esta reflejado la gran confianza del Mariscal quien presenta como primeros camaradas y primeros companeros de armas del Partido a quienes contribuyeron a convertir la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea en el pais con armas nuclear de talla mundial.
					
					 Tuvo lugar este martes la ceremonia de entrega de regalos con la participacion del miembro del Buro Politico y secretario, del Comite Central del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, Pak To Chun y otros funcionarios correspondientes, los cientificos, tecnicos, obreros, constructores militares y funcionarios de la rama de la ciencia de defensa nacional.
					
					 Pak pronuncio la palabra de entrega de regalos y otros intervinieron.
					
					 Los oradores manifestaron la decision de transmitir generacion tras generacion la gloria de hoy y dedicar toda la inteligencia y la energia para desarrollar con rapidez la tecnologia nuclear del pais.

articles.title: Active Three-Revolution Team Members Pay Respects to Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Active Three-Revolution Team Members Pay Respects to Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il 
 Pyongyang, February 26 (KCNA) -- The participants in a national meeting of active three-revolution team members on Tuesday visited the Kumsusan Palace of the Sun to pay deep respects to President Kim Il Sung and general secretary Kim Jong Il.
					 They entered the hall where statues of Generalissimos Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il are standing, while looking back on the immortal feats of them who strengthened the three-revolution team movement and led the work of the three-revolution team members in each period and at each stage of the development of the revolution.
					
					 They paid tribute to Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il.
					
					 Then they entered the halls where the Generalissimos lie in state and paid tribute to them. 
					
					 They went round the hall where orders the Generalissimos received are on display and the halls which house cars, electric car, boat and train coaches used by them during their field guidance and foreign trips till the last moments of their lives.

articles.title: Project of New Hi-Temperature, Air Combustion Rolling Furnace Completed at Steel Complex
articles.content:
Project of New Hi-Temperature, Air Combustion Rolling Furnace Completed at Steel Complex 
 Pyongyang, February 26 (KCNA) -- A project for introducing a high-temperature, air-combustion technology by the gasification of anthracite was successfully completed at the Chollima Steel Complex by its own efforts and technology within a year and four months.
					 The workers of the complex newly built a gas-generator shop and a large hi-temperature, air-combustion heating furnace for rolling.
					
					 The use of hi-temperature, air-combustion technology will provide a foundation for massively producing rolled steel by relying on the supply of coal rich in the DPRK, instead of expensive fuel. It also made a big advance in making the country's metallurgical industry more independent.
					
					 The heating furnace for rolling has been fully computerized ranging from the automatic operation and monitoring of temperature and pressure to protection. 
					
					 The gasification and modernization of the rolling process of the complex is the behests of general secretary Kim Jong Il. 
					
					 The complex started the project on July 6, Juche 100 (2011). It established the technological gasification process for producing hundreds of thousands of tonnes of rolled steel a year. 
					
					 It introduced the world trend of development and advanced technology for hi-temperature and air-combustion heating to suit the specific conditions in the DPRK and completed more than 1 000 designs within three months. 
					
					 In the first-stage project, the complex finished the drive of dismantling huge concrete structure in 20 days, concrete tamping for settling tank of gas producer and wall-plastering in 10 odd days and the construction of pumping station for circulating waters in only 4 days. 
					
					 Dozens of invention proposals and technical innovation proposals were introduced to produce equipment and pipes weighing hundreds of tonnes. 
					
					 The assembling of washing towers and moisture-separator was finished in three days, cutting by more than a half the assembling period of gas producer. 
					
					 The workers of the egg coal production field, pilot of the gasification project, took the lead in the assembling of equipment and carried out the first trial operation. 
					
					 The workers of the complex removed the old heating oven and built the hi-temperature, air-combustion heating furnace 20 days earlier than scheduled, making it possible to hasten the trial operation. 
					
					 A general control station was built in the middle of the premise of the complex for monitoring and commanding the overall production processes and for helping technicians and workers receive tele-education lectures from scientific and educational bodies. 
					
					 There also appeared industrial buildings and cultural and welfare establishments. 
					
					 Also built were a park, a fish farm, a volleyball court and open-air resting places in good harmony with lawn covering 10,000 square meters.

articles.title: Nanhutou Meeting, Watershed in Anti-Japanese Armed Struggle
articles.content:
Nanhutou Meeting, Watershed in Anti-Japanese Armed Struggle 
 Pyongyang, February 26 (KCNA) -- It has been 77 years after President Kim Il Sung convened the historic Nanhutou meeting in the period of the anti-Japanese armed struggle.
					 At that time, the Japanese imperialists intensified harsh crackdown upon the Korean people as never before, in preparation for aggression on mainland China.
					
					 Under the situation, Kim Il Sung hardened his decision to advance the Korean People's Revolutionary Army (KPRA) into the homeland to show the Korean people that Korea is alive.
					
					 To this end, he called a meeting of KPRA military and political cadres in Nanhutou, China's Ningan County, on Feb. 27, Juche 25 (1936).
					
					 At the meeting, he reviewed the military and political activities conducted by the KPRA in areas along the River Tuman in the first half of the 1930s and set forth new strategic policies on the basis of scientific analysis of the prevailing situation and the requirement of the developing revolution.
					
					 The policies involved the issues of advancing the main KPRA forces into the border area adjacent to Korea as well as the area of Mt. Paektu for anti-Japanese armed struggle in the homeland, expanding the movement for anti-Japanese national united front on a nationwide scale and stepping up preparations for founding a party.
					
					 The policies enjoyed full support at the meeting.
					
					 The Nanhutou meeting was of historic significance as it represented Kim Il Sung's steadfast independent stand that the Korean revolutionaries were responsible for the Korean revolution and the Koreans should make the Korean revolution.
					
					 Since then, the Korean revolution entered a new phase of its development in the homeland.

articles.title: U.S. Is to Blame for Nuclear Crisis in Korea: Scholars
articles.content:
U.S. Is to Blame for Nuclear Crisis in Korea: Scholars
 Pyongyang, February 26 (KCNA) -- The United States and other hostile forces are now kicking up a row over the 3rd underground nuclear test, conducted successfully by the DPRK, dubbing it a "provocation". 
					 In this regard, KCNA had an interview with Ri Kyong Chol, a section chief, and Jong Hyok, a researcher, of the Law Institute under the Academy of Social Sciences.
					
					 Question: Would you like to tell me about the motive of the DPRK's nuclear test?
					
					 Answer (Ri): The U.S. hostile policy towards the DPRK has reached an extreme phase and its high-handedness has become more rampant after the DPRK's satellite launch.
					
					 Thereby, the DPRK had no other choice but to react to it with military muscle. 
					
					 The 3rd underground nuclear test was a self-defensive measure taken by the DPRK in response to the U.S. and its followers' anti-DPRK moves over its satellite launch, recognized as a legitimate right of all sovereign states under the International Outer Space Treaty.
					
					 The U.S. prodded the UN Security Council into cooking up an anti-DPRK "resolution" over its satellite launch, creating an unprecedentedly acute situation on the Korean Peninsula.
					
					 The UNSC "resolution on sanctions" has no ground in view of international law. It is just a product of the U.S. sense of antagonism and antipathy for a country with different idea and social system and its arrogant view that a small country should be obedient to a big one.
					
					 If the DPRK remains a passive onlooker to the "resolution", it will be left without right to use outer space and, furthermore, the right to existence as a sovereign state.
					
					 Such arrogant action of the U.S. should be countered only with strength. The U.S. has threatened a preemptive nuclear strike at the DPRK with its satellite launch as an excuse, thus posing a biggest threat to its security.
					
					 By international law any state has a right to take any step needed to defend its supreme interests. Hence, the DPRK openly conducted the nuclear test.
					
					Q: The U.S. persistent nuclear threat prompted the DPRK to get access to nukes. What do you think about it?
					
					 A (Jong): The U.S. has long deployed a number of nuclear weapons in and around south Korea, starting with the shipment of nuclear missile Honest John into south Korea half a century ago, in violation of the Armistice Agreement.
					
					 Terming the DPRK an "axis of evil", the U.S. adopted a preemptive nuclear attack on the DPRK as one of its policies. And it has annually carried on "Key Resolve", "Foal Eagle" and other military exercises for preemptive nuclear attack on the DPRK.
					
					 This forced the DPRK, which is technically at war with the U.S., to get access to nukes.
					
					 The DPRK's nuclear deterrent serves as a sure guarantee for defending the nation's sovereignty and dignity and ensuring peace and stability of the Korean Peninsula and the rest of the world.
					
					 Q: I think the successful 3rd underground nuclear test displayed the might of DPRK's strong deterrent.
					
					 A (Ri): You are right. The recent test was no more than a prelude to the toughest measures to be taken by the DPRK to cope with the U.S. imperialists' reckless provocations.
					
					 International bodies and foreign experts are of the view that the explosive power of the latest nuclear blast is ten times more powerful than the first one and two times more than the second. 
					
					 This proved in an objective way the correctness of the KCNA report that the test was conducted on a high level with the use of smaller and lighter yet more powerful A-bomb unlike the previous ones.
					
					 The test is as good as a punishment to the U.S. hostile bid to hinder the DPRK's peaceful development as well as a serious warning to the hostile forces hell-bent on the anti-DPRK moves.
					
					 The DPRK has already stated that it will take tougher steps as long as the U.S. persists in its anti-DPRK moves.
					
					 Time will prove that victory in an all-out action against the U.S. and for the cause of justice is in store for the Korean people.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il Praised by Syrian Personage
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Praised by Syrian Personage
						
 Pyongyang, February 26 (KCNA) -- Saber Ballul, department head of the Political Faculty of University of Damascus of Syria, released a statement on Feb. 14 to mark the birth anniversary of general secretary Kim Jong Il.
					 The statement said:
					
					 Kim Jong Il was a great leader who left a priceless legacy for guaranteeing the eternal foundation of socialist Korea and its rosy future.
					
					 He was an outstanding thinker and theoretician who formulated the revolutionary idea of President Kim Il Sung as an integral system of the idea, theory and method of Juche and glorified it as a great guiding idea in the era of independence.
					
					 He was also an invincible iron-willed commander who turned the DPRK into an impregnable fortress of socialism any imperialists dare not provoke and strengthened the Korean People's Army into a strong army.
					
					 Marshal Kim Jong Un, supreme leader of the Korean people, is wisely leading the Korean people's struggle for a final victory under the uplifted banner of Songun by successfully carrying forward the revolutionary cause of the preceding leaders.
					
					 The Korean people single-mindedly united around Kim Jong Un will always emerge victorious, decisively shattering all the moves of the U.S. and forces kowtowing to it.

articles.title: DPRK's Nuclear Test Supported by Body of Belarus
articles.content:
DPRK's Nuclear Test Supported by Body of Belarus
 Pyongyang, February 26 (KCNA) -- The Social Federation "For the Union and Union's Communist Party" of Belarus released a statement on Feb. 15 in support of the DPRK's 3rd underground nuclear test.
					 The statement said:
					
					 Following the DPRK's success in the nuclear test the imperialists' propaganda media blamed the Korean people who rose to defend the interests of the country.
					
					 The country is strictly abiding by international law and other countries also demand that the legitimate right of the DPRK be recognized in a fair way.
					
					 The DPRK threats no other country and it has only defended its security from aggression of the imperialists.
					
					 This country, exposed to constant military threats from the U.S., has equipped itself with modern military hardware capable of repulsing any aggressor at a single strike under the banner of Songun.
					
					 If the U.S. truly wants the Korean Peninsula to be peaceful, it has to sign a peace treaty with the DPRK.
					
					 We condemn the U.S. for moving to dominate the Asia-Pacific region after stifling the socialist country DPRK by force of arms.

articles.title: Meeting for Solidarity with Korean People Held in Democratic Congo
articles.content:
Meeting for Solidarity with Korean People Held in Democratic Congo
 Pyongyang, February 26 (KCNA) -- A solidarity meeting was held in Kinshasa on Feb. 19 under the sponsorship of the Communist Party of Democratic Congo to hail the DPRK's successful launch of satellite Kwangmyongsong 3-2 and third underground nuclear test.
					 Present there were leadership members of the Communist Party and masses.
					
					 Boswa Isekombe Sylvere, general secretary of the Party, said in a speech that the U.S. wantonly violated the legitimate right of the DPRK regarding the use of space for peaceful purposes, taking issue with its peaceful satellite launch in December of last year and fabricating at last the illegal "resolution on sanctions" against it by prodding the UN Security Council.
					
					 The U.S. is also accusing the DPRK of its nuclear test for protecting its sovereignty, the speaker said, adding:
					
					 The present international situation is teaching us a serious lesson that any dialogue and negotiations with the imperialists should be based on one's own strong military muscle and that only the people who are united close behind their leader can protect their country's sovereignty and ensure their independent development.
					
					 We, who love world peace and justice, can not remain onlookers to the anti-DPRK moves of the U.S. and forces kowtowing to it.
					
					 We will positively support the just cause of the Korean people.
					
					 A statement adopted at the meeting urged the U.S. and its allies to immediately stop their mad-cap confrontation moves against the DPRK, and the UNSC to retract at once the "resolution on sanctions" against it.

articles.title: Works of Kim Jong Il, Kim Jong Un Carried by Russian Paper
articles.content:
Works of Kim Jong Il, Kim Jong Un Carried by Russian Paper
 Pyongyang, February 26 (KCNA) -- General secretary Kim Jong Il's work "The Songun-based Revolutionary Line Is a Great Revolutionary Line of Our Era and an Ever-Victorious Banner of Our Revolution" and the dear respected Kim Jong Un's speech at the Fourth Conference of Cell Secretaries of Workers' Party of Korea were carried by the Russian paper Patriot No. 7.
					 Kim Jong Il's work, published on Jan. 29, Juche 92 (2003), clarifies the idea that the Songun revolutionary line, the Songun politics of the Workers' Party of Korea is a powerful political mode which carried forward and developed President Kim Il Sung's idea and line of attaching importance to arms, and a scientific revolutionary line and political mode which reflected the demand of the era and revolution most correctly.
					
					 Kim Jong Un's work, issued on Jan. 29, Juche 102 (2013), made clear the issue arising in enhancing the function and role of party cells, the tasks for improving their work and the idea on enhancing the sense of responsibility and role of secretaries of the party cells.
					
					 The paper carried a portrait of Kim Jong Il and photos on revolutionary activities of Marshal Kim Jong Un.

articles.title: Kimjongilia Shows Held in Russia
articles.content:
Kimjongilia Shows Held in Russia
 Pyongyang, February 26 (KCNA) -- Kimjongilia shows took place at Gaban Hotel in Vladivostok, Russia and an exhibition museum in Nakhodka, Russia on February 5 and 7 on the occasion of the birth anniversary of general secretary Kim Jong Il (the Day of the Shining Star).
					 The hotel and museum are associated with his revolutionary activities.
					
					 Visiting the venues of the shows were figures of the administrations of Maritime Territory, Nakhodka, Vladivostok, Artyom and Partizansk cities and political parties, organizations and Juche idea study organizations, those people who have been received by Kim Jong Il and other people.
					
					 The visitors expressed their admiration for the beauty of Kimjongilia.
					
					 The deputy general director of the "Vlad Khleb" Bread Factory affirmed that the admiration for Kim Jong Il, who made great contributions to the development of the friendly relations between Russia and the DPRK would be cherished in the hearts of Russians along with red Kimjongilias in full bloom.
					
					 An assistant professor of Far Eastern State University said that he felt more deeply about the international authority of Kim Jong Il while cultivating Kimjongilia on the occasion of the Day of the Shining Star.
					
					 The chairman of the Far Eastern Association for the Study of Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism said that Korea would surely be reunified and shed its rays as a thriving nation and that the friendly relations between Russia and the DPRK would steadily develop.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Exploits Praised by Foreign Newspapers
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Exploits Praised by Foreign Newspapers
						
 Pyongyang, February 26 (KCNA) -- Foreign newspapers carried special write-ups on the occasion of the birth anniversary of general secretary Kim Jong Il.
					 The Russian paper Patriot No. 7 carried articles on full eight pages illustrated with the portrait of a smiling Kim Jong Il and photos documenting the revolutionary activities of Kim Jong Il and the dear respected Kim Jong Un.
					
					 The articles were entitled "Ever-victorious banner of revolution", "Declaration of February", "Tribute to Generalissimos in DPRK", etc.
					
					 The paper introduced in their articles the revolutionary career and immortal exploits of Kim Jong Il.
					
					 The Mongolian paper Mongolyn Medee on February 14 carried an article titled "Songun politics and Korean Peninsula" under the headline of "The great leader Comrade Kim Jong Il will live forever" illustrated with his photo.
					
					 The paper praised his exploits in Songun leadership, saying that the Songun politics pursued by him is being successfully carried forward by Supreme Leader Kim Jong Un.
					
					 The Thai paper Xing San Daily on February 9 carried special write-ups under the title of "Feats in socialist cause" illustrated with the portrait of a smiling Kim Jong Il.
					
					 The paper said that he performed immortal exploits in the socialist cause.
					
					 It said that Kim Jong Il made public works one after another, which proved the inevitability of the triumph of socialism. The paper added that the historic Pyongyang declaration "Let Us Defend and Advance the Cause of Socialism" was adopted in April, 1992 thanks to his leadership.

articles.title: Birth Anniversary of Kim Jong Il Marked Abroad
articles.content:
Birth Anniversary of Kim Jong Il Marked Abroad
 Pyongyang, February 26 (KCNA) -- Events took place in different countries on the occasion of the birth anniversary of general secretary Kim Jong Il.
					 There were meetings in Pakistan and Nigeria, round-table talks in Ethiopia and demonstration performance of Taekwon-Do practitioners in South Africa from Feb. 3 to 16.
					
					 The chairman of the Pakistan Association for Self-Reliance Studies, the general secretary of the Sind Provincial Committee of the Pakistan Awami National Party and other speakers said that Kim Jong Il's immortal exploits would shine for all ages, praising him as an extraordinary leader who devoted his all to the cause of global independence.
					
					 The administrative director of the Niger State Government of Nigeria expressed his conviction that the Korean people would achieve greater success in the drive for building a thriving nation and accomplishing the national reunification under the leadership of the dear respected Marshal Kim Jong Un who is successfully carrying forward the cause of President Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il.
					
					 The acting general director of a travel company in Ethiopia praised Kim Jong Il for successfully applying the Juche idea founded by Kim Il Sung to achieve the single-hearted unity in whole society and for providing a powerful nuclear deterrent to make any imperialist forces dare not provoke the DPRK.
					
					 A chief designer of the Metal and Machine Co, Ltd. in Ethiopia noted that through the third underground nuclear test the Korean people fully demonstrated that Korea does what it is determined to do.
					
					 Congratulatory messages to Kim Jong Un were adopted at the events in Pakistan and South Africa.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Feats Introduced by Foreign Organizations, Institutions
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Feats Introduced by Foreign Organizations, Institutions
 Pyongyang, February 26 (KCNA) -- Organizations and institutions of different countries posted special write-ups on their websites from Feb. 13 to 15 on the occasion of the birth anniversary of general secretary Kim Jong Il.
					 The France-Korea Friendship Association carried an article illustrated with a photo of the statues of President Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il on Mansu Hill.
					
					 The article said that instituting the birth anniversary of Kim Jong Il as the Day of the Shining Star is a reflection of the unanimous aspiration and desire of all the Korean people for glorifying his exploits for all ages.
					
					 By pursuing his original Songun politics, he defended the sovereignty of the country, opened up the turning phase of building a thriving nation and made a great contribution to carrying out the national reunification, it noted.
					
					 The Nigerian National Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea carried an article praising him for comprehensively pursuing the Songun politics in the mid-1990s, making public a lot of works and thus clarifying the way for carrying out the socialist cause.
					
					 The Swiss preparatory committee for celebrating the Day of the Shining Star carried many articles saying that he left the trace of patriotic devotion in every nook and corner of the country, built the national capacity in every way by pursuing the original Songun politics and provided the powerful war deterrent.
					
					 The Switzerland-Korea Committee, Swiss Group for the Study of the Juche Idea, Kim Jong Il Library in Ecuador, Anti-Imperialist Front of France and the Society for the Promotion of the Relations between Austria and the DPRK posted articles on the feats he performed in the Korean revolution and the cause of global independence.

articles.title: Korean Film Shows Held Abroad
articles.content:
Korean Film Shows Held Abroad
 Pyongyang, February 26 (KCNA) -- Korean film shows were held in Slovakia, Guinea and Nigeria from February 15 to 17 on the occasion of the birth anniversary of general secretary Kim Jong Il.
					 Shown there were "Pyongyang at Night" and other Korean films.
					
					 The chairman of the Slovak Association for Supporting the Juche Idea introduced in detail eye-opening successes being achieved in the DPRK, praising Kim Jong Il's immortal exploits of Songun leadership.
					
					 The vice-chairman of the Guinean Society for the Study of the Juche Literary Idea said that Kim Jong Il was a genuine leader of the people who devoted his all to them, adding that he found joy in their happiness and did not spare anything for them.
					
					 The chairman of the Group for the Study of the Juche Idea in Conakry, Guinea noted that his exploits would shine forever along with the future of socialist Korea winning victory after victory, adding that he was a man possessed of extraordinary military wisdom and stratagem.

articles.title: Day of Shining Star Marked Abroad
articles.content:
Day of Shining Star Marked Abroad
 Pyongyang, February 26 (KCNA) -- Special programs were aired in foreign countries from Feb. 8 to 16 to mark the birth anniversary of general secretary Kim Jong Il.
					 His portrait and photos documenting his Songun revolutionary leadership feats and revolutionary activities of the dear respected Kim Jong Un were broadcast on MNCTV of Mongolia.
					
					 The Cambodian State Radio and F.M. 90.5 Radio under the title of "Kim Jong Il's patriotism" broadcasted that patriotism which he embodied in practice is peculiar one which can go only by his august name for its essence and great vitality.
					
					 Radios of Guinea aired under the title of "Human cause of independence and Kim Jong Il" that he provided guidelines for accomplishing the cause of global independence.
					
					 A radio of the country broadcasted under the title of "Kimjongilia in full bloom all over planet" that shortly after the immortal flower was cultivated to see the light, it evoked a great sensation in many countries and regions. It added that Guinea is also cultivating Kimjongilia as part of the world-wide active movement to care for the  flower and disseminate it.
					
					 Television Station Tele Andina 23 of Ecuador broadcasted Korean films "Fireworks for a Thriving Nation" and "Tower of the Juche Idea".

articles.title: Kim Jong Un dirige ejercicios de golpe con fuegos de artilleria
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un dirige ejercicios de golpe con fuegos de artilleria
 Pyongyang, 26 de febrero (ACNC) -- El Mariscal Kim Jong Un, Primer Secretario del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, Primer Presidente del Comite de Defensa Nacional de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y Comandante Supremo del Ejercito Popular de Corea, ordeno realizar los ejercicios de golpe con fuegos de artilleria para revisar la capacidad de batalla real de las unidades de artilleria y los dirigio en el terreno.
					 Tras informarse por parte del comandante de ejercicios el plan de su desarrollo y el estado de ubicacion de las subunidades de fuegos, dio orden del inicio de ejercicios.
					
					 Los canonazos estremecieron la tierra y los proyectiles convirtieron la "posicion enemiga" en un mar de fuegos.
					
					 El Comandante Supremo se mostro satisfecho por la exacta punteria  de la artilleria y agrego que si se llevan los ejercicios a la batalla real, los enemigos recibiran un golpe demoledor del indignado ejercito revolucionario del  monte Paektu.
					
					 El evaluo altamente el exitoso desarrollo de tiros.
					
					 Senalo que dio de modo inesperado la orden a las unidades para examinar la disposicion de combate y agrego que todos los oficiales y los soldados se mantienen en estado de alerta esperando la orden de ataque final del Comandante Supremo, lo que fue confirmado otra vez a traves del presente simulacro.
					
					 Presento las tareas programaticas que se presentan en la perfeccion de los preparativos del combate del ejercito popular.
					
					 Enseno detalladamente los asuntos para modernizar mas la artilleria frente a los persistentes e imprudentes ejercicios de guerra de agresion de los enemigos.
					
					 Apunto que todos los artilleros del EPC deben estar bien dispuestos para dar golpe demoledor a los enemigos segun la orden si ellos tiran fuegos.
					
					 El mismo dia, el Mariscal dio revista a los nuevos armamentos desarrollados por el EPC.
					
					 Y se fotografio junto a los oficiales y soldados participantes en los ejercicios.
					
					 Le acompanaron Choe Ryong Hae, Hyon Yong Chol, Kim Kyok Sik, Kim Yong Chun, Ri Yong Gil, Son Chol Ju, Ryom Chol Song, Jo Kyong Chol, Yun Tong Hyon, Kim Yong Chol, Pak Jong Chon, Yun Tong Hui, Kim Thaek Gu, Pak Tong Hak, Rim Kwang Il, Choe Pu Il, O Il Jong, Kim Kyong Ok, Ri Jae Il, Ra Chong Il y Hong Yong Chil.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un presencia la funcion del Coro Estatal Benemerito
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un presencia la funcion del Coro Estatal Benemerito
						
 Pyongyang, 26 de febrero (ACNC) -- El Mariscal Kim Jong Un, Primer Secretario del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, Primer Presidente del Comite de Defensa Nacional de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y Comandante Supremo del Ejercito Popular de Corea, presencio con los oficiales y soldados del EPC la funcion del Coro Estatal Benemerito "Si Corea decide, lo cumple".
					 El respondio cordialmente a las efusivas aclamaciones de los espectadores.
					
					 En la funcion, iniciada con la musica orquestal y coro masculino "Cancion del Ejercito Popular de Corea", se presentaron los coros masculinos "Patria radiante", "Kim Jong Il siempre esta vivo como el Sol" y "Ordene, Lider", el duo y coro masculinos "Si Corea decide, lo cumple", los coros masculinos "Nuestra bayoneta garantiza la paz" y "Defenderemos a costa de la vida al General Kim Jong Un", entre otras piezas.
					
					 Dando testimonios de su infinita veneracion hacia los Generalisimos Kim Il Sung y Kim Jong Il quienes prepararon el inagotable poderio de la Corea del Songun, los cantantes elogiaron la incomparable audacia y extraordinario arte de mando del Mariscal Kim Jong Un quien dirige al frente el enfrentamiento total de todo el ejercito y pueblo para defender la soberania del pais.
					
					 El Mariscal expreso agradecimiento a los artistas mostrandose muy complacido de que ellos hayan ofrecido una funcion magnifica en que se denotan claramente el caracter y atributo revolucionarios del EPC y se palpa la voluntad de la Corea del Songun.
					
					 Comparando la funcion con una tronada igual al fuego simultaneo de lanzacohetes reactivos, dijo que presenciandola, redoblo una vez mas la conviccion de continuar la revolucion empunando el fusil.
					
					 Evaluo en particular la "Cancion del Ejercito Popular de Corea" agregando que esta pieza fue interpretada en tono alegre y optimista mostrando el impetu combativo de ejercito revolucionario.
					
					 Al final, expuso la esperanza y conviccion de que los creadores y artistas del coro estimularan al ejercito y pueblo a la lucha por la victoria final a traves de sus actividades artisticas de caracter revolucionario y combativo.
					
					 Le acompanaron en disfrutar el espectaculo Choe Ryong Hae, Hyon Yong Chol, Kim Kyok Sik, Kim Yong Chun, Kim Jong Gak, Ri Yong Gil, Son Chol Ju, Ryom Chol Song, Jo Kyong Chol, Yun Tong Hyon, Kim Yong Chol, Pak Jong Chon, Yun Tong Hui, Kim Thaek Gu, Pak Tong Hak, Rim Kwang Il, Choe Pu Il, O Il Jong, Kim Kyong Ok, Ri Jae Il, Ra Chong Il y Hong Yong Chil.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un felicita a Raul Castro Ruz
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un felicita a Raul Castro Ruz 
 Pyongyang, 26 de febrero (ACNC) -- El Mariscal Kim Jong Un, Primer Presidente del Comite de Defensa Nacional de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, envio el dia 25 un mensaje de felicitacion a Raul Castro Ruz, Presidente del Consejo de Estado de la Republica de Cuba.
					 El texto va como sigue:
					
					 Le hago llegar a Vd. mis calurosas felicitaciones por su reeleccion como presidente del Consejo de Estado de la Republica de Cuba en el primer periodo de sesiones de la VIII legislatura de la Asamblea Nacional del Poder Popular de Cuba.
					
					 Deseo a Vd. mayores exitos en su trabajo responsable por defender la soberania y la dignidad del pais y llevar a feliz termino la causa socialista.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un envia regalos a contribuyentes a la prueba nuclear
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un envia regalos a contribuyentes a la prueba nuclear 
 Pyongyang, 26 de febrero (ACNC) -- El Mariscal Kim Jong Un envio presentes a los cientificos, tecnicos, obreros, constructores militares y funcionarios quienes contribuyeron al exito de la tercera prueba nuclear subterranea.
					 En ellos esta reflejado la gran confianza del Mariscal quien presenta como primeros camaradas y primeros companeros de armas del Partido a quienes contribuyeron a convertir la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea en el pais con armas nuclear de talla mundial.
					
					 Tuvo lugar este martes la ceremonia de entrega de regalos con la participacion del miembro del Buro Politico y secretario, del Comite Central del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, Pak To Chun y otros funcionarios correspondientes, los cientificos, tecnicos, obreros, constructores militares y funcionarios de la rama de la ciencia de defensa nacional.
					
					 Pak pronuncio la palabra de entrega de regalos y otros intervinieron.
					
					 Los oradores manifestaron la decision de transmitir generacion tras generacion la gloria de hoy y dedicar toda la inteligencia y la energia para desarrollar con rapidez la tecnologia nuclear del pais.

articles.title: En Pyongyang jugador retirado de NBA y su comitiva
articles.content:
En Pyongyang jugador retirado de NBA y su comitiva 
 Pyongyang, 26 de febrero (ACNC) -- Arribaron este martes a esta capital el jugador retirado de NBA (Asociacion Nacional de Baloncesto) de Estados Unidos, Dennis Rodman y su comitiva.
					 Los huespedes fueron acogidos en el aeropuerto por el vicepresidente del Comite Olimpico de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Son Kwang Ho y otros funcionarios interesados.

articles.title: Ofrecido banquete en honor de contribuyentes a la prueba nuclear
articles.content:
Ofrecido banquete en honor de contribuyentes a la prueba nuclear
 Pyongyang, 26 de febrero (ACNC) -- Se ofrecio este martes en el Hotel Internacional Yanggakdo un banquete en honor de los cientificos, tecnicos, obreros, constructores militares y funcionarios quienes contribuyeron al exito de la tercera prueba nuclear subterranea.
					 Asistieron Choe Yong Rim, Choe Thae Bok, Pak To Chun, Jo Yon Jun y otros funcionarios interesados.
					
					 Fueron invitados los contribuyentes de la rama de ciencia de defensa nacional a la tercera prueba nuclear. 
					
					 Los cuadros del Partido y el Estado y los empleados del Hotel les acogieron con amabilidad. 
					
					 En la ocasion hizo uso de la palabra el miembro del Buro Politico y secretario, del Comite Central del Partido del Trabajo de Corea.
					
					 El orador apunto que el exito en la prueba nuclear es el acontecimiento especial y gran jubilo nacional producido por la ferrea voluntad y la audacia incomparable del Mariscal Kim Jong Un.
					
					 Llamo a los trabajadores de la rama de la ciencia de defensa nacional a responder con fidelidad a la gran confianza y la esperanza del partido guardando siempre las benevolencias del Mariscal.
					
					 Insistio en la necesidad de registrar grandes innovaciones y saltos con el espiritu y el impetu de haber realizado exitosamente la prueba nuclear guardando en el corazon el patriotismo de Kim Jong Il para contribuir a manifestar sin reserva la dignidad y el poderio de la potencia del monte Paektu.
					
					 Hubo la funcion artistica de felicitacion de los empleados del Hotel.
